sentences: Ta ei ärritu kunagi, tal on paks nahk.
Kes ühiskorteris elab, peab paksu nahaga olema.
context: The word 'paksu' is the partitive case form of 'paks' (thick) used in combination with 'nahk' (skin). It describes someone who has a thick skin and is not easily offended by criticism or insults. This phrase is typically used to describe people who are resilient, calm, and don't get upset easily even when faced with harsh comments or difficult situations.
